rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/88.104.224.164|88.104.224.164]] to last version by MIT Trekkie

rv, this paragraph doesn't seem to be about "liberal commentators" and the film site is too general to be useful. I could only find an animation of O'Reilly, links need to be more on point
rv; no source cited, and self-proclamation by talking heads does not (necessarily) affect biases in production

Remove NPOV label and you will be reported.
rv POV tag addition; please explain on Talk page before re-adding
I dont think this article conforms to NPOV standards. I am adding an NPOV warning.
/* History */ "The slogan is now ubiquitous." is redundant here
revert duplicate sentences. Noitall this is all in the history section.
continued vandalism of article by Shem, continued removal of vital sourced info
Noitall, you have created duplicate sentences right next to one another. Please help expand the "history" section.
Shem is just out to cause problems now
Moved new history to history section, removed duplicated information.
moved previous edit to History section
added Ken Auletta interview as source for Murdoch's viewpoint. Added NPOV sentence.
"Edit war," I think not. I've provided a more NPOV alternative, and you've flung insults.
dumb and blind is more like it, you are really going to edit war over the most notable slogan in news?
You're quite right, I'm not "fair and balanced" on Wikipedia. I'm accurate, and NPOV. Wikipedia is not Fox News, and your edit summaries evidence your needing a read-over of [[Wikipedia:Civility]].
are you kidding me Shem? This is sourced 1000 times per day, looks like its Shem that is not fair and balanced
The information is unsourced, and makes POV assertations against competitors from the get-go. I'm game for a sourced history section, though, and have started one for you to expand.
rv to 69.64.213.146, notable descriptive info removed
rv anon; use less vulgar edit summaries, please.
Statement needs sourcing, and aside, if this article can allege liberal bias at CNN from the get-go, can Fox News' right-wing allegations be included as well? Article needs a "History" section, maybe
/* On-air personalities */ removed POV (provide link to show "popularity" please
/* Other criticisms */ WPXT is no longer a Fox affiliate
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ Rmv POV listing, again.

explanation of why FNC was started
Ailes has, in the past, claimed affiliate actions as Fox News' own. I'm only using his standard. The lengthy smear against every non-Fox outlet has no place in this article; edit their articles.
The whole criticism section is currently an POV attack against FNC. In the internest of the NPOV policy, there should be no problem with inlcuding POV rebuttals to every point of criticism.
Actions taken by affiliates do not indicate bias at Fox News Channel
Rmv POV smear toward other media outlets.
fixed Rupert Murdoch and Newscorp relationship language, using language from News Corp article
Rupert does not personally own News
it is company that is part owned by Murdoch, it isn't his, please stop restoring nonsense

FOX News moved to Fox News
shifting logo down a bit to remove whitespace at top of article
Revert "to a good version," what? This has already been discussed, Silverback. See talk and cease POV deletions.
switch around message for something more specific
adding message at top to see talk page
rv to good version prior to protection. "Right-wing" conservative is redundant, are there left wing ones? we should attribute any name calling, was it Kennedy, Chomsky?
Done, Ilyanep. Keep this version for tommorow.
revert POV until dispute is resolved
/* Ratings success */ I could've sworn I sourced this earlier.
Unexplained removals by anon; please include specific edit summaries when deleting content.
Pejorative, you mean, Silverback; and no, it is not. It is an accurate ideological descriptor. Also, you moved to misrepresent Franken's book. Please cease POV deletions.
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ typo
/* On-air personalities */ restoring James colmes documentation
/* Major news stories first broken by Fox News */ wikifying oil for food
rv back, you aren't requesting documentation that they are conservative or republican, please delete those labels if you are, I am demanding that right-wing be attributed, since it is a perjorative
/* On-air personalities */ attribute POV that Colmes is "liberal"
/* Major news stories first broken by Fox News */ wikiying oil-for-food
Reverted; Silverback, you're just trying to play semantics now. "Conservative" and "Republican" aren't attributed either; they are the descriptive ideological sum of allegations against FOX News.
the right wing references still hasn't been documented and attributed, especially the one about the audience
/* Ratings success */ Revert 24.186.137.160 to last version by Bigdavediode; vandalism.
remove undocumented CNN ratings claim, Such short duration viewers probably include Headline News, which is not comparable to Fox at all.
/* External links */ Restored externals, but expanded and made POV's known.
replace external links which were removed
Revert Silverback to last version by Dfmock; right-wing is no more "gratuituous" than "conservative," and a distinction should be made where conservatism is concerned.
left a couple "right-wings" in, most are gratuitious
/* Programming */ adds Rockefeller Center reference -- the Fox building is part of the same 1960s Rockefeller Center addition that includes the Time and Life Building
Correction; Cavuto is described as "anchor," not "host."
Cavuto: Positions within FOX News, popular columnist, removed a misplaced comma.
There is a distinction between conservatism and right-wing politics, Silverback. The term was not pejorative, and the distinction should be made.
You continue to use language singling out a single editorial on Cavuto; this is not the case, Silverback. "Deferential" is the most accurate adjective, please cease POV deletion.
"Populist commentary" is not why O'Reilly is criticized, and you know it, Silverback.
/* On-air personalities */ noone speaks for "the left", "some on the left" is what is justified by the source, well perhaps just "one on the left", i'll think about it, is there a better source?
/* On-air personalities */ already the newspaper called him that after the interview, but there is still nobody alleging it was deferential. Thanx for the better links.
/* On-air personalities */ O'Reilly isn't right wing or conservative, he is a reactionary populist, with authoritarian stands on issues such as immigration and the borders
/* On-air personalities */ not all of these are news anchors, some are more personalities on opinion shows, such as Hannity.
/* On-air personalities */ removed a redundant and perhaps perjorative "right wing", it should be reserved for those who self identify as such.
/* Major news stories first broken by Fox News */ removing kerry pen story - see talk page
/* Major news stories first broken by Fox News */ new source for the kerry pen story
restore Fox reporting section, adding the Oil-for-food scandal successes. If blogs were first on the pen story, document it.
Removed non-notable "Kerry pen" story; FYI, that "story" was investigated by bloggers first, not Fox News.
/* Major news stories first broken by Fox News */adding picture
Reverted Silverback; deliberate misrepresentation of critics, and deletion of legitimate NPOV material. See talk (you have refused to discuss thus far), and cease your POV edits/deletions.
rv, Sidaway did not give valid reason for his revert of these changes, which conform to the supplied sources.

removing POV material not supported on talk page

"Deferential" is not POV langauge, nor is a single newspaper the only critic to use the phrase "Bush apologist." Use this article's talk page before further POV deletion.
/* On-air personalities */ absurd to suggest that all left criticism of Colmes is from " anti-globalism anarcho-progressives"
/* On-air personalities */ if you have a non-partisan source you'd like to defend for these perjorations, do your own web search, this is what your source justifies so far
This article has more controversy than encyclopedic information

/* On-air personalities */ Updated Tony Snow's information.
/* On-air personalities */ Changed wording on Hannity to note the nature of the "Hannity and Colmes" show.
/* On-air personalities */ Re-worded sentence to account for anchors who do not deny being, or are proud of being, right-wing or conservative.
Shortened header title; also, headlining is no longer done with all first letters of words capitalized (exceptions: acronyms and proper nouns).
/* Allegations of Bias among On-air Personalities */ no orignal research, no documentation was provided that Colmes has been called a "Fox news liberal", either here or on the wikilinked page
/* Allegations of Bias among On-air Personalities */ critics was an over generalization, the source did not state that it was after a deferential interview
/* Allegations of Bias among On-air Personalities */

maybe waiting longer than 3 min would help

restore useful information added over last 2 weeks - see talk
